result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane J Cataldo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete high school education.  Obtain and maintain employment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Absolute sobriety is required.
Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  No driving unless properly licensed. Must reside with mother until such time as mother and agent approve of other residence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Shane J Cataldo in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Shane J Cataldo in custody.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin as a special prosecutor.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
PSI received and reviewed.  
State's recommendation is for 3 yrs confinement and 3 yrs extended supervision to be imposed and stayed with 3 yrs probation on the felony BJ.  Will also recommend some jail time.  On the misdemeanor charges, probation is also recommended.
State's sentencing argument.  State is not in agreement with defendant's expungment request, but will defer to the Court.
Defense sentencing argument.
Statement by defendant's mother
Statement by defendant
BTC:  Ct 1 (1548) 30 days RCJ, cfts, $300 + cc  PPP $25/mo FTP 10 days RCJ.   PPP begins 08/01/16
           Ct 3 (1548) BJ - 6 yrs> 3 yrs confinement,  3 extended supervision i/s, 3 yr probation
no alcohol, controlled substances, absolute sobriety
programming recommended, relapse prevention, etc
cognitive behavior therapy
360 days RCJ stayed
CFTS to be applied to prison sentence
CIP and SP eligible
reside with mother until such time as mother and agent approve
complete high school education
obtain employment
maintain sobriety
no driving unless property licensed
firearm warning, voting prohibited
DNA sample and surcharge
other court costs waived on BJ and theft
expungment authorized upon successful completion of probation on the felony only
       14CF760:   RSP - probation 1 yr conc with BJ, same conditions
       15CF1752:  thefts - probation 1 yr conc
No contact with named victims, co-actors
(1 DNA sample and surcharge.  All other costs waived)
Sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Shane J Cataldo in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Shane J Cataldo in custody.  Andrew Herman appeared for Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Still waiting on discovery.
St- Will get discovery to attorney Cruz.
BTC: Motions in Limine, proposed verdict form and customized jury instrustions to be filed by March 1st @ 5pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Must reside in his mothers home at 2332 Gillen Street Racine WI. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. No contact with the victim or co defendant (person, property, residence or family). Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

BTC: In 14CF760 & 14CF1548 $1,000 cash bond is forfeited. $1,000 cash bond set. Placed on GPS monitoring, must reside with his mother at 2332 Gillen Street Racine, WI, not to consume or possess any drugs or alcohol with ZCI to monitor and is to have no contact with the victims or co defendant.
